brief_summary.textblock:
We are evaluate the effectiveness of a new telephone-based home cardiac rehabilitation on patient participation in rehab, exercise capacity, quality of life, cardiovascular events, and mortality.
Eligible patients who are hospitalized for myocardial infarction, percutaneous coronary intervention, cardiac surgery, or heart failure will be invited to participate in the telephone-based home cardiac rehabilitation program. If patients do not want to participate in the home program, they will be offered referral to a facility-based cardiac rehabilitation (usual care). Facility-based and home-based cardiac rehabilitation programs are equally effective.
Our new home-based program is based on a cardiac rehabilitation program endorsed by the American Heart Association (AHA) using the workbook and DVD, "An Active Partnership for the Health of Your Heart". Patients will receive worksheets for recording exercise and food intake, written instructions for equipment, and other materials to supplement the Active Partnership book. After hospitalization, patients will be instructed on use of the study equipment (portable exercise peddler, pedometer, heart rate monitor, and blood pressure cuff) and given an individualized exercise prescription by an exercise physiologist.

arm_group.description: A comprehensive cardiac rehabilitation program delivered remotely that the subject can participate in from home.
The center-based cardiac rehabilitation is the standard of care offered to subjects refered to cardiac rehabilitation programs.

intervention.description: The intervention is a 12 week, home-based lifestyle intervention that includes counseling regarding heart healthy lifestyle changes.
The intervention is a health center-based cardiac rehabilitation program that involves counseling in healthy heart behaviors and exercise delivered in a clinical setting.

Post MI, CABG, PCI, or stable angina Able to speak, read and write in english
Exclusion Criteria:
Class IVCHF Unstable Angina Complex Ventricular Arrythmias EF <35% without AICD AICD candidate Resting SBP >200mmHG Resting DBP>110mmHG Cognitive Impairment by MoCA Score <26 Life expectancy <1 year
